hints.label: def-u1-gauge-field
hints.title: U(1) Gauge Field on Fractal Set
hints.content:
309: :label: def-u1-gauge-field
310: 
311: **Source:** [13_E_cst_ig_lattice_qft.md § 4.1, lines 527-561]
312: 
313: A **U(1) gauge field** (electromagnetic field) on $\mathcal{F}$ assigns parallel transport operators to edges:
314: 
315: **CST edges (timelike):**
316: 
317: $$
318: U_{\text{time}}(e_i \to e_j) = \exp\left(-i q A_0(e_i, e_j) \tau_{ij}\right) \in U(1)
319: 
320: $$
321: 
322: where:
323: - $A_0$: Temporal component of gauge potential (electric potential)
324: - $\tau_{ij}$: Proper time along edge (episode duration)
325: - $q$: Electric charge (coupling constant)
326: 
327: **IG edges (spacelike):**
328: 
329: $$
330: U_{\text{space}}(e_i \sim e_j) = \exp\left(i q \int_{e_i}^{e_j} \mathbf{A} \cdot d\mathbf{x}\right) \in U(1)
331: 
332: $$
333: 
334: where:
335: - $\mathbf{A}$: Spatial components of gauge potential (vector potential)
336: - Integral along geodesic from $\mathbf{x}_i = \Phi(e_i)$ to $\mathbf{x}_j = \Phi(e_j)$ in emergent metric $g$
337: 
338: **Gauge transformation:** Under $U : \mathcal{E} \to U(1)$:
339: 
340: $$
341: U(e_i, e_j) \mapsto U(e_i) U(e_i, e_j) U(e_j)^{-1}

hints.label: def-sun-gauge-field
hints.title: SU(N) Gauge Field on Fractal Set
hints.content:
347: :label: def-sun-gauge-field
348: 
349: **Source:** [13_E_cst_ig_lattice_qft.md § 4.2, lines 571-610]
350: 
351: For **non-abelian gauge group** $G = SU(N)$ (e.g., $SU(3)$ for QCD), parallel transport operators are **$N \times N$ unitary matrices**:
352: 
353: **CST edges:**
354: 
355: $$
356: U_{\text{time}}(e_i \to e_j) = \mathcal{P} \exp\left(-i g \int_{e_i}^{e_j} A_0^a T^a dt\right) \in SU(N)
357: 
358: $$
359: 
360: **IG edges:**
361: 
362: $$
363: U_{\text{space}}(e_i \sim e_j) = \mathcal{P} \exp\left(i g \int_{e_i}^{e_j} A_i^a T^a dx^i\right) \in SU(N)
364: 
365: $$
366: 
367: where:
368: - $A_\mu^a$: Gauge field components ($a = 1, \ldots, N^2 - 1$)
369: - $T^a$: Generators of $SU(N)$ (Lie algebra basis)
370: - $g$: Gauge coupling constant
371: - $\mathcal{P}$: Path-ordered exponential
372: 
373: **Physical interpretation:**
374: - $SU(2)$: Weak interaction

hints.label: unlabeled-remark-74
hints.title: Relationship Between Discrete and Continuous Gauge Groups
hints.content:
380: :class: important
381: 
382: **Three-Tier Gauge Hierarchy:**
383: 
384: The framework exhibits a **hierarchical structure** of gauge symmetries:
385: 
386: **1. Fundamental Discrete Symmetry ($S_{|\mathcal{E}|}$):**
387: 
388: The permutation group $S_{|\mathcal{E}|}$ is the **fundamental symmetry** of the algorithmic dynamics—episodes are indistinguishable particles, and the framework is invariant under episode permutations (Chapter 12). This discrete symmetry is **exact** at the finite-N level and provides the topological structure (braid holonomy).
389: 
390: **2. Derived Continuous Symmetries ($U(1) \times SU(2)$):**
391: 
392: The continuous Lie groups $U(1)$ and $SU(2)$ are **rigorously derived** from algorithmic parameters (Chapter 1, `01_fractal_set.md` §7.5-7.10):
393: 
394: - **$U(1)_{\text{fitness}}$ (Global):** From **diversity companion selection** with phase $\theta_{ik}^{(U(1))} = -d_{\text{alg}}(i,k)^2/(2\epsilon_d^2\hbar_{\text{eff}})$ ({prf:ref}`thm-u1-fitness-global`)
395:   - Represents fitness self-measurement
396:   - Defines diversity edges in Information Graph
397: 
398: - **$SU(2)_{\text{weak}}$ (Local):** From **cloning companion selection** with phase $\theta_{ij}^{(SU(2))} = -d_{\text{alg}}(i,j)^2/(2\epsilon_c^2\hbar_{\text{eff}})$ ({prf:ref}`thm-su2-interaction-symmetry`)
399:   - Represents weak isospin doublet structure
400:   - Defines cloning edges in Information Graph
401: 
402: - **$SU(3)_{\text{color}}$ (Local):** From **viscous force vector** $\mathbf{F}_{\text{viscous}}(i) = \nu \sum_j K_\rho(x_i, x_j)(v_j - v_i)$ ({prf:ref}`thm-su3-strong-sector`)
403:   - Color state: $|\Psi_i^{(\text{color})}\rangle \in \mathbb{C}^3$ from complexified force components with momentum-phase encoding
404:   - Color charge: $c_i^{(\alpha)} = F_\alpha^{(\text{visc})}(i) \cdot \exp(i m v_i^{(\alpha)}/\hbar_{\text{eff}})$
405:   - Gluon fields: $U_{ij} = \exp(i \sum_a g_a \lambda_a A_{ij}^a)$ with Gell-Mann generators
406:   - Confinement: Localization kernel $K_\rho$ provides short-range coupling
407: 
408: **3. Grand Unified Theory Extension (SO(10)):**
409: 
410: Extension to SO(10) GUT that unifies gauge forces with gravity via spinor framework.
411: 
412: **Current Status:**
413: 
414: - **$S_{|\mathcal{E}|}$ permutation gauge:** ✅ **Rigorously defined** (Chapters 12, 14)
415: - **$U(1)_{\text{fitness}}$ global gauge:** ✅ **Rigorously derived** from diversity companion selection (Chapter 1 §7.6)
416: - **$SU(2)_{\text{weak}}$ local gauge:** ✅ **Rigorously derived** from cloning companion selection (Chapter 1 §7.10)
417: - **$SU(3)_{\text{color}}$ local gauge:** ✅ **Rigorously derived** from viscous force vector (Chapter 1 §7.13)
418: - **Full Standard Model ($SU(3) \times SU(2) \times U(1)$):** ✅ **Complete** (all components derived!)
419: - **General Relativity:** ✅ **Rigorously derived** from fitness Hessian curvature (Chapter 1 §7.14)
420: - **Spinor storage framework:** ✅ **Rigorously defined** (all fields stored as spinors on CST edges for frame-covariance)
421: - **SO(10) GUT:** ⚠️ **Partially rigorous** (conceptual framework complete, technical details incomplete)
422: 
423: **SO(10) Status Breakdown:**
424: 
425: | **Component** | **Status** | **Reference** |
426: |---------------|-----------|---------------|
427: | 16-dim spinor representation | ✅ Correct structure | Chapter 1 §7.15 |
428: | Spinor storage on CST edges | ✅ Rigorously defined | Chapter 1, Def. `def-curvature-storage` |
429: | Frame-covariance rationale | ✅ Complete | Spinors vs. tensors argument |
430: | Gravitational sector derivation | ✅ Metric from Hessian | Chapter 1 §7.14 |
431: | SO(10) generator matrices | ✅ Formula provided | Chapter 1, Def. `def-so10-generator-matrices` |
432: | Curvature spinor encoding | ✅ Explicit definition | Chapter 1, Def. `def-riemann-spinor-encoding` |
433: | Explicit 16×16 gamma matrices | ⚠️ Computational | Need numerical matrices for implementation |
434: | Lie algebra verification | ⚠️ Not proven | Need to verify commutation relations |
435: | SU(3)×SU(2)×U(1) embeddings | ⚠️ Formulas given, not proven | Need explicit verification |
436: | Riemann spinor dimension count | 🚨 **CRITICAL ISSUE** | Dimension mismatch: 20 vs 16 components |
437: | SO(10) connection from algorithm | 🚨 **MISSING** | Core claim - must derive from Fragile Gas operators |
438: | Yang-Mills action derivation | 🚨 **MISSING** | Holy grail - derive from cloning/kinetic operators |
439: | Symmetry breaking mechanism | ⚠️ Not derived | Higgs → reward connection requires proof |
440: | Coupling constant unification | ⚠️ Not derived | Relate $\alpha_{\text{GUT}}$ to algorithmic parameters |
441: 
442: **New Document:** See [09_so10_gut_rigorous_proofs.md](09_so10_gut_rigorous_proofs.md) for detailed analysis of missing proofs and identified gaps.
443: 
444: **Key Insight:** The **Standard Model gauge group** $SU(3)_{\text{color}} \times SU(2)_{\text{weak}} \times U(1)_{\text{fitness}}$ is **completely derived** from algorithmic dynamics:
445: - $U(1)$: Diversity measurement (fitness self-assessment)
446: - $SU(2)$: Cloning interaction (weak isospin)
447: - $SU(3)$: Viscous coupling (color confinement)
448: 
449: **Critical Innovation:** All fields (gauge, gravity, matter) stored as **spinors** on CST edges, not tensors/vectors. This ensures:
450: 1. Frame-covariance under Lorentz/SO(10) transformations
451: 2. Intrinsic geometric structure (no position-dependent Jacobians)
452: 3. Natural unification of gravity with gauge forces in 16-dim SO(10) spinor
453: 
454: The hierarchical structure is:
455: 
456: $$
457: SO(10)^{\text{spinor}} \supset S_{|\mathcal{E}|}^{\text{discrete}} \times [SU(3)_{\text{color}} \times SU(2)_{\text{weak}} \times U(1)_{\text{fitness}}] \times GR^{\text{spinor}}

hints.label: def-discrete-field-strength
hints.title: Discrete Field Strength Tensor
hints.content:
465: :label: def-discrete-field-strength
466: 
467: **Source:** [13_E_cst_ig_lattice_qft.md § 5.2, lines 680-715]
468: 
469: For an **oriented** plaquette $P = (e_0, e_1, e_2, e_3, e_0)$ in $\mathcal{F}$, the **field strength** (plaquette holonomy) is:
470: 
471: $$
472: F[P] = U(e_0 \to e_1) U(e_1 \sim e_2) U(e_2 \to e_3)^{\dagger} U(e_3 \sim e_0)^{\dagger}
473: 
474: $$
475: 
476: where:
477: - Forward edges use parallel transport $U$, return edges use adjoint $U^{\dagger}$ (reversed transport)
478: - $U(e_i \to e_j)$ for CST edges (timelike), $U(e_i \sim e_j)$ for IG edges (spacelike)
479: - Plaquette orientation: Chosen consistently (e.g., counterclockwise around $e_0 \to e_1 \to e_2 \to e_3 \to e_0$)
480: - The adjoints $U^{\dagger}$ represent transport along the reversed direction ($e_3 \to e_2$ and $e_0 \leftarrow e_3$)
481: - **Antisymmetry:** Reversing orientation $P \to P^{-1}$ gives $F[P^{-1}] = F[P]^{\dagger}$, providing the required antisymmetry of the field strength tensor
482: 
483: **Physical interpretation:** This measures the **commutator** of parallel transport around a closed loop, which is the discrete analog of the curvature $[D_\mu, D_\nu] = F_{\mu\nu}$.
484: 
485: **Small loop expansion:** For small plaquettes (lattice spacing $a \to 0$):
486: 
487: $$
488: F[P] = \mathbb{I} + i a^2 F_{\mu\nu} + O(a^3)
489: 
490: $$
491: 
492: where $F_{\mu\nu}$ is the continuum **field strength tensor** (electromagnetic tensor or Yang-Mills curvature).
493: 
494: **For U(1) gauge theory:**
495: 
496: $$
497: F[P] = e^{i q \Phi[P]}
498: 
499: $$
500: 
501: where $\Phi[P]$ is the magnetic flux through plaquette $P$:
502: 
503: $$
504: \Phi[P] = \int_P F_{\mu\nu} dx^\mu \wedge dx^\nu \approx F_{\mu\nu} \cdot \text{Area}(P)
505: 
506: $$

hints.label: def-wilson-gauge-action
hints.title: Wilson Lattice Gauge Action
hints.content:
514: :label: def-wilson-gauge-action
515: 
516: **Source:** [13_E_cst_ig_lattice_qft.md § 6.1, lines 772-806]
517: 
518: The **Wilson action** on the Fractal Set is:
519: 
520: $$
521: S_{\text{Wilson}}[A] = \beta \sum_{\text{plaquettes } P \subset \mathcal{F}} \left(1 - \frac{1}{N} \text{Re} \, \text{Tr} \, U[P]\right)
522: 
523: $$
524: 
525: where:
526: - $\beta = 2N / g^2$: Inverse coupling constant (for gauge group $SU(N)$ or $U(1)$)
527: - $U[P]$: Plaquette holonomy (Definition {prf:ref}`def-discrete-field-strength`)
528: - $N = \dim(G)$: Dimension of gauge group representation
529: - Sum over all plaquettes in $\mathcal{F}$ (mixed CST-IG 4-cycles)
530: 
531: **Continuum limit:** As lattice spacing $a \to 0$:
532: 
533: $$
534: S_{\text{Wilson}} \to \frac{1}{4g^2} \int d^4x \, F_{\mu\nu} F^{\mu\nu}
535: 
536: $$
537: 
538: (Yang-Mills action in continuum).
539: 
540: **For U(1) theory:** $N = 1$, so:
541: 
542: $$
543: S_{\text{Wilson}} = \beta \sum_P (1 - \cos(\Phi[P]))
544: 
545: $$
